channel.title: On a blank source.. 2 questions
channel.description: 1. Why is there no character files!?!? I cant find the folder. 2. How do I put makeglobalobject method thing in there. I searched it and its not there.

item.title: On a blank source.. 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Bandos_Pk, post:1, topic:260954”]1. Why is there no character files!?!? I cant find the folder.
2. How do I put makeglobalobject method thing in there. I searched it and its not there.[/quote]

  1. login to the server, log out. it should be there then.
  2. client.java

i am not saying anymore as you know what to search.

TIP: there might not be any global objects in the server yet. you will have to make them yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: On a blank source.. 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I’ll just give you the method for it.

[code] public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType) { // Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
client person = (client) p;

            if ((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
                if (person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60) {
                    person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation,
                            tileObjectType);
                }
            }
        }
    }[/code]

Then if you don’t have public void NewObjects() { already, then make it and add your objects under that.

Read full topic

item.title: On a blank source.. 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“cod3r chris, post:2, topic:260954”]For makeglobalobject just add this code:

makeGlobalObject(Xcoord, Ycoord, Object ID, 0, 10);//telescope

The 0 is the way you want the object to face. As for the 10, leave that default, it really does nothing. Sorry if this didn’t help, I don’t code blank sources.[/quote]

Obviously that’s not going to work if he doesn’t have a method called makeGlobalObject…

Read full topic

item.title: On a blank source.. 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @cod3r_chris cod3r chris
item.description:
@cod3r_chris wrote:

For makeglobalobject just add this code:

makeGlobalObject(Xcoord, Ycoord, Object ID, 0, 10);//telescope

The 0 is the way you want the object to face. As for the 10, leave that default, it really does nothing. Sorry if this didn’t help, I don’t code blank sources.

Read full topic
